Description: Body sherd of Etruscan bucchero pottery kantharos with possible traces of silvering; impressed small circles at carination.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Leiden University, Faculty of Archaeology. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Marked 'N' on outside (very faint). Finds of Etruscan bucchero at Naukratis are discussed in A. Naso, 'Etruscan and Italic finds in North Africa, 7th-2nd century BC', in Villing, A. and Schlotzhauer, U. (eds) 2006a, Naukratis: Greek Diversity in Egypt. Studies on Greek Pottery and Exchange in the Eastern Mediterranean (British Museum Research Publication 162), London, 187-198 (for the kantharos in Leiden, see esp. 189 fig. 3, 194, no. 20).
Bibliographic references: van de Wiel 1968 / Verzameling ceramiek en Terracotta's Archaeologisch Instituut der Rijksuniversiteit Leiden (p. 8, N 25, pl. 2, N 25)
Prins de Jong 1925 / Scherben aus Naukratis: Aus der Sammlung des Universitäts-Professors Dr Fr W Freih von Bissing (p. 55-6, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GQ.01)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: T.2930 (Musée Scheurleer (The Hague) Registration number)
